summary: The Department of the Treasury administers the "Do Not Pay" system, which agencies use to verify if people are eligible for certain payments. The Social Security Administration pays for death data from states to know when to stop its benefit payments. Treasury recently gained access to this data for the Do Not Pay system, and it projects benefits of approximately $337 million for the first...
title: Social Security Death Data: Do Not Pay System Has Yielded Financial Benefits, but SSA Should Better Evaluate States’ Cost to Obtain Data
